text: Submittals approved for all duct materials, sizes, gauges, fittings, and accessories per SMACNA
Coordination confirmed with structural, electrical, sprinkler (avoid conflicts, enough space)
Shop drawings include elevations, turning vanes, transitions, and damper access
Duct gauge and reinforcements confirmed based on size and pressure class
All duct sections delivered clean, protected from weather and damage
Duct insulation type, thickness, and vapor barrier verified
Ducts installed plumb, level, properly supported per SMACNA standards (hanger spacing, support for risers)
Flexible duct lengths within limits (max 5–6 ft), and not kinked or compressed
Turning vanes installed in elbows where required
Volume dampers and access doors installed where shown and accessible
Smoke/fire dampers installed with breakaway joints, sleeves, fusible links, and access
Ductwork sealed (SMACNA Class A/B/C) per pressure class; leak test performed if required
All diffusers, grilles, registers (DGRs) installed per reflected ceiling plan
Duct insulation continuous and free of tears or exposed gaps
Final cleaning completed prior to startup (negative air sweep or vacuum)

id: • SMACNA Duct Construction Standards, ASHRAE 62.1, NBC 2019 Part 6, NECB
• Manufacturer Specs: Greenheck, Carnes, Price, Nailor, Loren Cook
